headline: Stellantis Shares Are Tumbling to Their Lowest Point in Over 5 Years. Here's Why
summary: Stellantis shares sank sharply Friday after the Jeep and Chrysler parent company announced a "reset" of its electric vehicle business and said it expects to post a net loss for 2025 as it records $26 billion in charges related to the pivot.

raw.headline: Stellantis Shares Are Tumbling to Their Lowest Point in Over 5 Years. Here's Why
raw.summary: Stellantis shares sank sharply Friday after the Jeep and Chrysler parent company announced a "reset" of its electric vehicle business and said it expects to post a net loss for 2025 as it records $26 billion in charges related to the pivot.

headline: Stellantis Stock Drops 25% After Giant EV Write-Down. It Won’t Pay a Dividend.
summary: An enormous write-down and dividend suspension have  Stellantis  stock plummeting on Friday.  The Chrysler parent announced one-time charges of €22 billion ($25.9 billion), including roughly $20 billion related to electric vehicles, $4.1 billion in warranty-related costs, and other items.  “The reset we have announced today is part of the decisive process we started in 2025, to once again make our customers and their preferences our guiding star,” said CEO Antonio Filosa in a news release.

raw.headline: Stellantis Stock Drops 25% After Giant EV Write-Down. It Won’t Pay a Dividend.

The Chrysler parent announced one-time charges of €22 billion ($25.9 billion), including roughly $20 billion related to electric vehicles, $4.1 billion in warranty-related costs, and other items.  “The reset we have announced today is part of the decisive process we started in 2025, to once again make our customers and their preferences our guiding star,” said CEO Antonio Filosa in a news release.

headline: How Stellantis's $26 Billion EV Hit Stacks Up Against Some Notorious Writedowns
summary: Stellantis is taking a $26 billion hit due to heavy investment in electric vehicles, not long after Ford took a similar, $19.5 billion charge.  ☎️ Worldcom: The collapsed telecom provider in early 2003 said it would take $79.8 billion of writedowns, months after filing for bankruptcy, as part of a restatement of earlier earnings.  ? AOL Time Warner: The disastrous media merger prompted a $54 billion charge in the first quarter of 2002 and a $45.5 billion charge in the fourth quarter that year, writing down the value of both of the merged businesses.

raw.headline: How Stellantis's $26 Billion EV Hit Stacks Up Against Some Notorious Writedowns

AOL Time Warner: The disastrous media merger prompted a $54 billion charge in the first quarter of 2002 and a $45.5 billion charge in the fourth quarter that year, writing down the value of both of the merged businesses.

headline: Saying Goodbye To The Ford F-150 Lightning
summary: The Ford F-150 Lightning is probably the most significant effort by any automaker to enter the EV market and compete with Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA). It was an EV version of the best-selling vehicle in the nation, a place it has held for four decades. It was as close to a sure thing as possible, chasing ... headline: The Largest Write Off In Car Industry History
summary: Ford (NYSE: F) recently wrote off $19.5 billion due to the collapse of its EV business. GM (NYSE: GM) wrote off $6 billion because of the failure of its EV efforts, just after a $1.7 billion write-off for the same reason. The largest write-off in the history of car companies to date was GM’s $20.8 ... The Largest Write Off In Car Industry History

headline: Stellantis shares plummet on $26.5 billion writedown in EV pullback
summary: STORY: Stellantis shares plummeted just under a quarter early Friday (February 6).Investors sold off after it announced $26.5 billion of charges in the second half of last year.The charges came due to Stellantis scaling back its electric-vehicle ambitions.The selloff put shares close to their lowest level in almost six years.And the stock will see its biggest biggest one-day drop on record if the losses hold.The second-half charges follow similar, albeit smaller, writedowns by rivals including Ford and General Motors.That's as many Western automakers retreat from battery-powered models in response to the Trump administration's policies and soft demand.Stellantis CEO Antonio Filosa started downsizing the Fiat and Jeep maker's EV ambitions last year when he took over.Previous boss Carlos Tavares' strong bet on electrification resulted in a sales decline in Europe.And in the group's former profit powerhouse, the North American market.Stellantis will release final second half and full-year 2025 results later this month.

raw.headline: Stellantis shares plummet on $26.5 billion writedown in EV pullback
raw.summary: STORY: Stellantis shares plummeted just under a quarter early Friday (February 6).Investors sold off after it announced $26.5 billion of charges in the second half of last year.The charges came due to Stellantis scaling back its electric-vehicle ambitions.The selloff put shares close to their lowest level in almost six years.And the stock will see its biggest biggest one-day drop on record if the losses hold.The second-half charges follow similar, albeit smaller, writedowns by rivals including Ford and General Motors.That's as many Western automakers retreat from battery-powered models in response to the Trump administration's policies and soft demand.Stellantis CEO Antonio Filosa started downsizing the Fiat and Jeep maker's EV ambitions last year when he took over.Previous boss Carlos Tavares' strong bet on electrification resulted in a sales decline in Europe.And in the group's former profit powerhouse, the North American market.Stellantis will release final second half and full-year 2025 results later this month.

headline: The Robot Revolution Is Real. Tesla, Hyundai, and More Stocks to Play It.
summary: Once the domain of science fiction, autonomous robots—think C-3PO from Star Wars or Baymax from Big Hero 6—are getting closer by the year.  At 2025’s CES electronics conference, there were a handful of humanoids, none of which seemed to catch the world’s attention.  At January’s conference, robots, including Boston Dynamics’ Atlas, a 6-foot-2-inch automaton weighing in at just under 200 pounds with a digital smiley face, were the stars.

raw.headline: The Robot Revolution Is Real. Tesla, Hyundai, and More Stocks to Play It.

At January’s conference, robots, including Boston Dynamics’ Atlas, a 6-foot-2-inch automaton weighing in at just under 200 pounds with a digital smiley face, were the stars.

headline: What Ford Motor (F)'s $19.5 Billion EV Reset and Hybrid Pivot Means For Shareholders
summary: In late January and early February 2026, Ford Motor Company outlined a sharp pullback from fully electric vehicles, flagging about US$19.50 billion in EV-related charges, discontinuing the pure electric F-150 Lightning, and reaffirming a first-quarter dividend of 15 cents per share payable on March 2, 2026. At the same time, Ford is reshaping its business mix by pivoting toward hybrids, extended-range EVs, and a new battery energy storage unit aimed at utilities and AI data centers. We’ll...
